Story #6 Part-3

  • April 08, 2021
  • Zizi

Kaluga was a city, where we conducted sessions with Nikolai quite often. I liked the city and the guy, who was my mother at the being born training. His name was Igor. I stayed at his place for a month and then rented a room. This was a first move with all my stuff and I had a lot of it.

I found a job beforehand and a company of friends right after I moved to Kaluga. The company was full of artists, painters, musicians. We were drinking, talking and listening to the music hanging out in parks and streets. Twice Kaluga was really sweet to me. I was tight on money and twice there were situations when I had no money left and no food at home. I was walking home after work and asked Kaluga for money from the bottom of my heart and I found money on the street. It was around 300-400 rubbles, just enough to hold on till the salary.

After half a year I felt the same way I felt in Smolensk. There was no place to grow. The city was too small for me. Luckily, the company I was working in decided to close our office. So in winter of 2010 I had to find another job, and I decided to give Moscow a try. I found a random job as a logistic and a room to share with my very old friend Kirill, who was planing to move to Moscow the same time. Kirill was playing an online game at night and slept in the morning, so we met on the sofa quite rare. We had one sofa, a floor carpet and a wardrobe. In the other room there was a couple. This place was fine for a short period of time, just an option for a new start. We lived together with Kirill for 2-3 months. The way to the job took me 1.5 hours on the metro one way plus a walk to the metro station around 20 min one way. So it was 3.5 hours to get to the office and back. I was exhausted all the time. Logistic in Moscow is a hell with constant traffic jams. So no-one get anywhere on time and all the angry calls went to me. After 2-3months I found a room close to the work, and it made my life a bit easier. At that time I wanted to meet some people, so I started to go to banya with one company. Banya is a dry sauna with a higher temperature. The company there was interesting and nice. I was going there once in two weeks. When spring came one of the men invited me to a music festival. He said their friends needed a cook for their tea tent. And they will pay for the festival ticket and provide a tent and food. I agreed. At the last moment the man said he could not come, so I should go to the metro station where the tea company will pick me up. I knew no-one in it. I looked at the man named Yura, who was organizing a tea tent, in the social net. He seemed nice. I collected my stuff and decided to see him first and if I feel anything bad, I will refuse to go at the metro station. But Yura turned to be great, and we are still in contact. He is a kind and nice person. , and the tea company liked my cooking and after that festival I went with them to festivals during the summer. On the festivals I met with my Smolensk company. I was very glad to see my men and a couple of times I helped them cook as well.

I continued my experiments with LSD, so I had a trip every festival. I saw different effects on people in that state depending on how they felt. I talked with those people, I saw their pain, their suffering and the roots of their suffering.

At one festival I had no LSD, so I hoped to find some at the festival. I came with my tea company and was cooking every day. Once I took an early morning shift, so when a man came begging for food I cooked him pancakes for free. He came back in some time and gave me a small cube of hashish. I was surprised, because I didn’t smoke. Then in the afternoon my friend came saying there’s a man with LSD named Lyosha. Lyosha did not want to sell LSD but to exchange it for something. It suited me perfectly. I met Lyosha, and he agreed to exchange the hashish cube, I got in the morning, for one LSD sugar cube. Lyosha prepared sugar cubes with a drop of LSD in it. I was going for a trip the following night, so Lyosha came to our camp to look at me in the trip. I did not like him at first. But he seemed interested in me. The Next day I was leaving the festival, because my boyfriend was making drama that I’m in the forest for a week. So he was going to come and pick me up. Lyosha caught me at the last minute before I left our tea camp. He walked me to my meeting point, but my boyfriend was late for 2 hours. So we set with Lyosha on the ground and talked. As I said, I did not feel he is the one, but he courted me really hard. Lyosha was the first person in my life with whom I felt loved, fully supported, accepted and believed in. We had trips together, as he was selling weed and LSD all the time. I shared with him everything, so he understood that I use LSD in my own productive way. I was always able to pull myself from any feelings and learned a lot about myself. It was like a room for me and I knew how to use it. I saw myself as a machine, a computer, a being consisted of lots and lots of layers. During the trips I was inspecting and going down from layer to layer. Lyosha suggested me to try to work the same way with someone. So we started having trips in a small group, looking in each other, observing and sharing what we noticed or saw. After a while I started doing personal sessions for people.

In 2011 when I met Lyosha he moved me to a vegan raw diet and lots of cleansing and fasting. I improved my health a lot. I became interested in the healthy eating very much and got the idea that it is nice to feed people with good food. I worked a lot in that sphere. I was a cook at first, then a chef, a production manager, top manager, and director. I worked with raw cookies and crispbread, raw dishes like porridges, soups and other dishes, and chocolate.

I was giving sessions during my weekends. I learned so much with my clients. At first, we both were taking LSD, then I realized that I can connect the person without anything. I found that I can contact a person through the eyes and I can see what the person see, feel what they feel, analyse and understand their belief structure as well as the roots of the problem, and what could lead to this and how to resolve it. The only necessity was the openness of the person. The client should not intentionally hide from me. I was practicing for 5 years in Moscow. Lots of people found me and came. With every client I had a feeling that this is the person, who was supposed to come. Like I met all of them before. Sometimes I even remembered when and in which form I saw them last time. Sometimes there were people whom I often meet, sometimes the ones whom I have not seen for a long time. “How do you know this?” you might ask. When I see someone I can feel the connection with and sometimes there’s a feeling that I missed this person so much, even if we just met. Other times I feel so comfortable and trustful with a person I might not know well, which means for me, that we knew each other before, and I do not miss them, even if we meet once in half a year. It’s like not enough time to miss, like they are with me all the time.

Lyosha became my husband in 1.5 year after we started dating and living together. He did not earn much and did not really try to change it. Right before the celebration and marriage party I asked myself if I should cancel everything, because he did not get any money for it. My mother and friends presented us just enough to pay for the rings and food. After the marriage we started walking down the hill. I was working a lot, and he was at home cooking dinner for me and giving a foot massage. It felt like I’m a man earning, and he is my wife. I tried to discuss it with him, but he always wanted to get money easily. And it never worked out. We were planing a kid, and Lyosha promised to stop smoking weed sometime before we start trying. He tried for three days and immediately became angry which created conflicts. He went back to smoking. So I made a decision we are not going to have a child yet. At that time I was working in a raw café. There was a team of 20 people. I came there as a cook but went along well with the owner and after a month he made me a chef, and then he fired a manager, whom I hired as a cook after a week I became a chef. Then one day the owner left the office. I called his wife, and she said that I can become a director. She raised my salary and changed the schedule of work. I learned everything about the papers and met the landlord, whom we paid cash every month. He liked me and explained some details about paying the bills and going to apply the needed papers to some offices. The owner’s wife liked me and trusted to hire people, and create the company culture. That was one of the best time in my life. First thing I did after entering my office, was visiting people working in all 3 rooms and inspiring them for a working day. We had tea gatherings with sweets at the café in the evenings or at my house or park nearby. Everyone prepared something special for a snack. There was a feeling of being a family. We all gathered at the café with one idea of being healthy and share our experience of raw food. We were on the same wave and inspired and supported each other. After 3 months of work in there I did a 40-day fasting. I had a mushroom trip one night and during it, I felt so dirty in the inside, so I decided to start fasting the following morning. First 2 weeks I had herbal tea with some honey, next 1 week I had one glass of pomegranate juice, next 3 weeks a glass of orange juice in the morning and one glass of pomegranate juice in the evening, and then I was on the apricot water and some juice for 2 weeks more. That was an interesting experience. I was very calm and balanced, because I did not really have any energy to waste. I was working full time at the café and resolved any arising conflicts fast. At that time I had massage and sauna often too. The man, who gave me massage, became one of my closest friends later. When spring came I felt like everything is clear and organized at a café, and I had no interest anymore. I felt like there’s no more space to grow in it. I left is for a start-up project for raw vegan deserts. We planned and did everything from a total zero. We were creating the production with the delivery. It took a lot of work. I was doing all possible roles in this. Sometimes I had to get the order, cook and deliver it. It was funny to play a different person on the phone after the order was delivered, and the client called to thank us. My relations with my husband became less and less close. I was working a lot and spent most of the weekends on the festivals where we sold our deserts.

In the beginning of summer 2015 I went to serve in the Vipassana meditation centre. I tried this meditation technic in 2013 in April. At those times I was fully on raw, so I ate salads and some fruits. I got a warm shower twice in 10 days, and I had almost no warm clothes. I was wearing everything I had with me, and washed the whole set every second evening. I wrapped the clothes around the heater, so I can wear this again the next day. The course took place in the summer camp, so there were 8 people in my room. The beds were pretty tight to each other. During the course I experienced pain all the time. On day 5 I felt like I am in hell. I went to the conducting teacher, and she gave me some very general answer and nothing helpful to reduce my pain. I was always hungry, cold, tired and in pain. It was hard. But I went through it, and on day 10 a man shared a full spoon of honey with tea with me. It was fantastic.

So, I went to serve almost after 2 years. The serving was amazing! The team was so warm and nice. We were laughing all the time. The conducting teacher was the head of Vipassana in Russia. He was very understanding and we were working hard. In that serving I met 3 people, who effected my life. First 2 were a nice couple, who seemed interesting. The girl was talking unusual things about the universe and our connection and some other stuff about past lives. The 3d person was a man I was attracted sexually to. It was so unusual, because I was married, and have never seen anyone as a man except my husband. I started asking myself about my marriage and my husband, about everything that happened. I also discussed this with that new girl, and she said that my husband is totally not a match for me. I don’t know what was happening, but I trusted that girl 100%. Soon after the course I decided to leave my husband. I felt like our story is over. I remembered some past lives together with him. And everything felt over. That we gave the lessons we were supposed to give each other. When I told my decision my husband cried and said he will do anything to save the marriage, but he did not really do anything. Everything remained the same for a month or two, and then I decided to move out, and we will apply for the divorce.

I was in contact with that couple from the course, and now it feels like I was kind of hypnotized. The girl asked me to throw away all the things which were my protecting stuff like small figures of demons, creatures and some stuffed animals. I left all of them in the street. Also, I told them about my pet. The girl said I should let him go. He is kind of demon, so I should clarify myself. So, one day I called him and told him that I want to let him go. He agreed. And I did a kind of meditation with him, I send him all my love and gratitude for all those years taking care of me. He accepted it all and turned into a shining vessel which meant that he moved to an upper level of being. I have never seen him again.

I left my husband and was going to visit the couple in Saint-Petersburg. On the train back to Moscow after the course I met a man from Cheboksary. He looked like a lost and shy child for me. I talked with him a lot and hugged him at the end. I gave him my phone number and have not heard anything from him till the last night before going to visit that couple. This man from Cheboksary called me in the evening saying he had to see me. I told him that I’m busy, and I’m leaving the city tomorrow. He was strongly insisting and finally, I agreed to have tea with him during the night. He picked me up on his car, and we went to my rented room. When I made tea, snacks, and we set down in my room. He started talking, and I saw and heard an absolutely different person. It felt like another soul was talking from this body. I have never experienced anything like this before or after. It felt like someone is talking through this man’s body. The man started talking about the couple I was going to visit. He said they are dangerous, they are misleading me. The fog fell of me and I started seeing clearly and became more attentive to his words. Previous 3 years I was absolutely concentrated on the heart area. I was very loving and giving. He said this will change. The energy will move up to the thought area, which means I will start looking for self-expression and realization. The concentration will go on myself. We were talking the whole night, and it felt like I was talking not to a human. But to someone, who sees more than I do and knows my future. I almost decided to cancel my trip, but realized I should go and check what the person said. He dropped me at the bus stop and I have never seen him again. When I arrived to Saint-Petersburg I was very attentive. The couple behaved like I am their child. It was extremely odd. They were having lots of stuffed animals at home and called them their kids. I saw their inner desire to have a real child, but the man was too scared of the responsibility, so they did not develop in the relations. After a couple of hours after my arrival we were cooking with the girl, and she asked if I told anything anyone about them. And I said that I shared some information with a man. The girl got mad and said I betrayed them and I did go through a special checking. We spent a day together, which was super awkward. I left them next day and was happy to go back home.

When I left my husband at first I was shocked sitting in a room I started to rent, but after a short time I felt free and happy again. In September 2015 I went to sit my second Vipassana course and was thinking about chocolate all the time. I thought that I should get the job, which was offered before the course. The job was a manager in a small chocolate production. The production was in the tiny village 100 km from Moscow. It was a 4-story house. They offered me a privet room and a salary of 40000 rubbles a month. I thought it might help to change the surrounding. I was walking a lot in the forest, set on the bench on a hill, spent all the time with nature. The closest store was a 40-min walk away. There was nothing around. There were 8 people living in the house, others were coming for work from another village. The food did not suit me. The company never paid me what was promised. I left everything behind and had nowhere to go, so I stayed. Probably the boss knew it and used it. Every time he was saying that I’m still studying or this is what you earned this month. It was almost always 30,000. At some point I started to work 6 days a week. It seemed I lived on my work. At the begging I remembered my ex-husband a lot. I wished he will find me, come and bring me home. But he never did. The home did not exist anymore and the idea of marriage and all the illusions about it were ruined. Everything changes. Anyone can one day change one’s mind and leave. There were people with disabilities on the production. And one day a boy arrived to the house. He had problems with communication. At the same time the boss decided to open a night shift. I was teaching a new team for the night and this weird boy how to clean our room. Every morning he knocked and yelled at my door: “it’s breakfast!” I have never had breakfast on my weekend. So this wake up was horrible. At one point I felt myself as if I was in a mad house. People were weird and I worked as a horse. Once I had 26 hours shift. I worked with the old team in the day and then checked the new night team. That night they were working with a milk chocolate. We had lots of problems with the recipe, so the mashing stuck after they finished making the mixture. The boss left with his girlfriend to Moscow for the weekend. So the team woke me up and the machine was totally stuck. I asked the man, who was looking after the house and technical stuff kind of a steward, to bring the team home. And when he was back we started to knock out the pistol in the middle of the machine. Finally, we got it out, and I washed everything till the morning and then made a plan for a new day, because the team needed to work through the day. Shortly after this, we hired a new man named Pasha from Moscow. I liked him immediately because he was normal. We stared walking together in the forest, had tea for hours and talked a lot. Pasha was a pretty soft guy even he was really tall with amazing very long hair and huge beard. So I started teaching him and another boy from the village everything about our work and machines. I worked with 2 boys and the other team was 2 girls. They were always laughing at Pasha and his beard. My boys made mistakes like not collecting the machine properly, forgetting to close the tap, and the chocolate will go through it from the side right on the floor. Once a boy dropped a huge jar with honey and covered half of the room with it. So at those times there was lots of work, food and fun. I gained 10 kg in 3 months. I was always tired and hungry. The company fed us with potato, bread, cheese, oatmeal and cabbage. For me, it was a killing diet. Especially after 80 percent raw. We got close with a Pasha. He added some light to the dark place I was in. I wanted to go to India for 3 years before that job and my ex-husband promised to take me there, and he never did. So after our divorce I made my mind to go to India in winter. I had a deal with a man I met in Vipassana meditation centre that he will meet me in Goa, and we will rent a house together. So I was working at a factory collecting all the money for this trip. I thought I will take a month trip as a vacation. But one more thing happened at that house.

I was communicating a lot with the steward because we always had some issues around the house. One morning I woke up because he entered my room. There were no locks on the doors. I was sleeping naked and the man laid in my bed, hugged me and stated to kiss me with a crazy desire. I was shocked. I could not stand up because this would turn him on even more, and he might get absolutely out of control. So I stayed under the blanket captured by my co-worker. I started to ask him to leave, to understand what he was doing. I told him that he should leave right and not to commit anything bad. Finally, my words reached him, and came back to his senses, realizing what he was doing. He jumped up and ran away. He was a man around 60. His wife was in Crimea. And he was working in the house.

I don’t know what this man imagined. I did not go to breakfast that day. It was my rest day. I got an SMS from this old man (the steward) that he was extremely sorry of what he has done. I’ve never replied. I did not see him after this. He was always avoiding me, and this was helpful for me. I did not say anyone except Pasha about this. And he said this was my fault. I was shocked. I shared the horror and got no support and even blame. His arguments were that I was always kind, nice and helpful with the old man. So he could easily image that I like him. But really! Who would do such a thing?! Anyway I decided I am not going to come back after this one-month vacation in India, so I bought a one way ticket and saved as much as I could.

At the end of November 2015 I told the boss that I’m not going to come back, so I suggested a boy from my team to take my place. I thought the boy everything during December and flew to Goa, India.
